Deprecated API

Contents

  • Deprecated Interfaces
  • Deprecated Classes
  • Deprecated Methods
  • Deprecated Constructors
  • Deprecated Interfaces 
    Interface and Description
    rx.Observable.OnSubscribeFunc
    use Observable.OnSubscribe
  • Deprecated Classes 
    Class and Description
    rx.plugins.RxJavaDefaultSchedulers
  • Deprecated Methods 
    Method and Description
    rx.Observable.create(Observable.OnSubscribeFunc)
    use Observable.create(OnSubscribe)
    rx.Observable.empty(Scheduler)
    use Observable.subscribeOn(rx.Scheduler) to schedule
    rx.Observable.error(Throwable, Scheduler)
    use Observable.subscribeOn(rx.Scheduler) to schedule
    rx.Observable.from(Iterable, Scheduler)
    use Observable.subscribeOn(rx.Scheduler) to schedule the work
    rx.observables.GroupedObservable.from(K, Observable)
    Use Observable.groupBy with element selector instead.
    rx.Observable.from(T)
    use Observable.just(T) instead
    rx.Observable.from(T[], Scheduler)
    use Observable.subscribeOn(rx.Scheduler) to schedule the work
    rx.Observable.from(T, T)
    use Observable.just(T) instead
    rx.Observable.from(T, T, T)
    use Observable.just(T) instead
    rx.Observable.from(T, T, T, T)
    use Observable.just(T) instead
    rx.Observable.from(T, T, T, T, T)
    use Observable.just(T) instead
    rx.Observable.from(T, T, T, T, T, T)
    use Observable.just(T) instead
    rx.Observable.from(T, T, T, T, T, T, T)
    use Observable.just(T) instead
    rx.Observable.from(T, T, T, T, T, T, T, T)
    use Observable.just(T) instead
    rx.Observable.from(T, T, T, T, T, T, T, T, T)
    use Observable.just(T) instead
    rx.Observable.from(T, T, T, T, T, T, T, T, T, T)
    use Observable.just(T) instead
    rx.Observable.merge(Iterable>, int, Scheduler)
    use Observable.subscribeOn(rx.Scheduler) to schedule
    rx.Observable.merge(Iterable>, Scheduler)
    use Observable.subscribeOn(rx.Scheduler) to schedule
    rx.Observable.merge(Observable[], Scheduler)
    use Observable.subscribeOn(rx.Scheduler) to schedule
    rx.Observable.mergeMap(Func1>)
    use Observable.flatMap(rx.functions.Func1<? super T, ? extends rx.Observable<? extends R>>)
    rx.Observable.mergeMap(Func1>, Func1>, Func0>)
    use Observable.flatMap(rx.functions.Func1<? super T, ? extends rx.Observable<? extends R>>)
    rx.Observable.mergeMap(Func1>, Func2)
    use Observable.flatMap(rx.functions.Func1<? super T, ? extends rx.Observable<? extends R>>)
    rx.Observable.mergeMapIterable(Func1>)
    use Observable.flatMapIterable(rx.functions.Func1<? super T, ? extends java.lang.Iterable<? extends R>>)
    rx.Observable.mergeMapIterable(Func1>, Func2)
    use Observable.flatMapIterable(rx.functions.Func1<? super T, ? extends java.lang.Iterable<? extends R>>)
    rx.Observable.multicast(Subject)
    use Observable.multicast(Func0) instead. This one caused nuanced bugs as it retains state.
    rx.Observable.onErrorFlatMap(Func1>)
    see https://github.com/Netflix/RxJava/issues/1465
    rx.Observable.startWith(Iterable, Scheduler)
    use Observable.subscribeOn(rx.Scheduler) to schedule
    rx.Observable.startWith(T[], Scheduler)
    use Observable.subscribeOn(rx.Scheduler) to schedule
    rx.Observable.toBlockingObservable()
    use Observable.toBlocking() instead
    rx.Observable.using(Func0, Func1>)
    use the other using method with different overloads
    rx.Observable.zip(Iterable, Func2)
    use Observable.zipWith(java.lang.Iterable<? extends T2>, rx.functions.Func2<? super T, ? super T2, ? extends R>)
    rx.Observable.zip(Observable, Func2)
    use Observable.zipWith(java.lang.Iterable<? extends T2>, rx.functions.Func2<? super T, ? super T2, ? extends R>) instead. Changed to match naming convention of Observable.mergeWith(rx.Observable<? extends T>), Observable.concatWith(rx.Observable<? extends T>), etc.
  • Deprecated Constructors 
    Constructor and Description
    rx.Subscriber(CompositeSubscription)
